subject: Rename vim-7.3-rpmlintrc to vim-rpmlintrc
commitMessage:
Rename vim-7.3-rpmlintrc to vim-rpmlintrc

This should be done in the previous commit, however due to a bug
in git-buildpackage it's not possible as superfluous patch is generated
which in turn causes build failure.
See https://bugs.tizen.org/jira/browse/DEVT-144

Change-Id: Iab51552edf5b7be86f1fa01a3f065b748b636bfc
Signed-off-by: Jacek Bukarewicz <j.bukarewicz@samsung.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.
Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Changes look fine, but please push the 'upstream/7.4' git tag to the remote repo.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Add smack aware behaviour to keep labels
commitMessage:
Add smack aware behaviour to keep labels

The Smack labels SMACK64, SMACK64EXEC and SMACK64MMAP
are preserved when editing files with either the normal
or the extended version of vim.

Change-Id: I78a0c549420b6eb9423326e5d89a5da4f9913f77
Signed-off-by: José Bollo <jose.bollo@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.
Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Patch Set 1:

The patch in src/os_unix.c does not look right.

Patch Set 1:

Could you be a little more precise please?

I can see two points that could hurt you:

 - The label length is 1024 but in fact the real value is 256. Well here it is only set for the function independently of SMACK because there is no real smack include that define it (sys/smack.h isn't a kernel include and needs a specific include, the libsmack that doesn't define functions to handle labels of files) and frankly can you say if the limit is 255 or 256 because of the terminating zero that is not properly handled. (are the that extended attribute SMACK64EXEC and SMACK64MMAP  filtered? not sure...) Do you want to limit to 255? Who cares? vi doesn't set the labels but copies it. If the label were good it will remains good, and conversely, that is not the problem of vi. Then taking, presumably, enough size in the stack to handle labels is just good.

 - Errors aren't handled. Okay, but what to do with errors? emit a warning? okay. why not. I will change that.
Uploaded patch set 2.
Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Do you have a plan to send this upstream?
Uploaded patch set 3.

Patch Set 3: Verified+1

I updated to patch with remarks coming from guy's of vim

Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Should be fine.

Patch Set 3: Verified+1 Code-Review+1

Could be merged ?
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.
